article: Volume Buttons on Apple TV Remote Not Working? Hereâ€™s What to Do
intro: Are the volume buttons on your Apple TV remote no longer working? This can be a frustrating issue to come across, but there are many different ways that you can fix it whether you have a Siri Remote or Apple TV remote. This wikiHow article lists troubleshooting steps to solve your issue.

points.name: Check the battery of your remote.

steps.title: A low or dead battery can cause the remote to malfunction and not work properly.Settings > Remotes and Devices > Remote
steps.subtitle: An alert will pop up on your TV screen when the batteries are low. However, you can always go to .
sub-points: Plug your Apple TV or Siri Remote into a power source using a Lightning cable (gen 1-2) or a USB-C cable (gen 3) to recharge a low battery. The 2nd and 3rd gen remotes are silver and larger than the 1st gen remote, which is black. You should leave it plugged in for about 30 minutes for a solid charge; however, the remote takes 3 hours to fully charge.

steps.title: Rebooting can fix connection issues.
steps.subtitle: To restart the remote, follow these steps:
sub-points: Press and hold the TV/Control Center and Volume Down buttons at the same time for about 5 seconds.
The status light on your Apple TV will turn off and back on.
Release the buttons and wait for another 10-15 seconds. You'll see a "Remote Disconnected" message on the screen.
Press any button on your remote. You'll see a "Remote Connected" notification on the Apple TV screen.

steps.title: The current configuration can cause the volume buttons to not work on your TV.Remotes and Devices > Volume Control
steps.subtitle: Go to Settings on your Apple TV, then go to .
sub-points: Change the remote volume setting, like using "TV via IR" instead of "Auto".

steps.title: The current pairing can be failing, causing buttons on your remote to work improperly.
steps.subtitle: You don't need to unpair before re-pairing.
sub-points: To re-pair your remote with your Apple TV, press  or  and the Volume Up buttons together for about 5 seconds.
If prompted, put your remote on top of your Apple TV to complete the pairing process.
